neighbors.name: Richard A. Jasinski
neighbors.claims: Richard A. Jasinski is the recorded owner of parcel 16.-1-23 in Genesee County ([Cider Solar Farm Project Area Tax Parcels Map](http://cidersolarfarm.com/assets/pdfs/public_exhibits/Exh_04.pdf)). The property is located within the Project Area for the 500-MW Cider Solar Farm in the towns of Elba and Oakfield ([Cider Solar Farm Project Area Tax Parcels Map](http://cidersolarfarm.com/assets/pdfs/public_exhibits/Exh_04.pdf)). There is no record of Jasinski holding any public office or speaking in local meetings on development issues.
neighbors.influence_justification: Private landowner; no public roles identified

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respected farming community figure (e.g. Farm Bureau rep) reach out to reassure him about fair lease terms and end-of-project land restoration plans. Emphasize that after the solar project’s lifespan, the land can be returned to agricultural use with minimal lasting impact.

citations.claim: Richard A. Jasinski is the recorded owner of parcel 16.-1-23 in Genesee County
citations.title: Cider Solar Farm Project Area Tax Parcels Map

citations.claim: The property is located within the Project Area for the 500-MW Cider Solar Farm
citations.title: Cider Solar Farm Project Area Tax Parcels Map

neighbors.name: Makayla Friedl
neighbors.claims: Makayla Friedl is listed as the owner of parcel 12.-1-6.2 in Oakfield, Genesee County, which is classified as 1.97 acres of agricultural land ([Genesee County Agricultural and Farmland Protection Board Packet](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/content/county/v/12/department-content/planning/agricultural-and-farmland-protection/2025-03-18-meeting-packet.pdf)). Her name does not appear in local news archives or public meeting records on development, suggesting she has not taken a visible stance on the proposed project. She holds no known civic or leadership positions in the community.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage her in a neighborly conversation highlighting how the project will address farmland preservation and protect property values in the area. Explain the developer’s efforts to minimize long-term impacts and note that nearby residents may be eligible for compensation or benefit programs to ensure fairness.

citations.claim: Makayla Friedl is listed as the owner of parcel 12.-1-6.2 in Oakfield, Genesee County
citations.title: Genesee County Agricultural and Farmland Protection Board Meeting Packet

neighbors.name: Scott Mabon
neighbors.claims: Scott M. Mabon is the recorded owner of parcel 12.-1-6.12 in Oakfield, Genesee County, comprising 3.10 acres ([Genesee County Agricultural and Farmland Protection Board Packet](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/content/county/v/12/department-content/planning/agricultural-and-farmland-protection/2025-03-18-meeting-packet.pdf)). This parcel is located in the vicinity of Friedl’s parcel (12.-1-6.2) ([Genesee County Agricultural and Farmland Protection Board Packet](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/content/county/v/12/department-content/planning/agricultural-and-farmland-protection/2025-03-18-meeting-packet.pdf)). No public information links Mabon to any official positions or statements on the project; he has not been noted in media or town minutes regarding local development debates.

approach_recommendations.engage: Arrange a one-on-one discussion (through a trusted local official or neighbor) to listen to any concerns he has about losing productive farmland or property impacts. Emphasize plans to minimize disruption and ensure the land’s long-term viability after the project, addressing any questions about how the solar farm will be decommissioned and the land restored.

citations.claim: Scott M. Mabon is the recorded owner of parcel 12.-1-6.12 in Oakfield, Genesee County
citations.title: Genesee County Agricultural and Farmland Protection Board Meeting Packet

neighbors.name: Thomas Elliott
neighbors.claims: Thomas Elliott is a resident of Elba, NY, listed as a member of the St. Teresa's Pastoral Council (2023-2024) [St. Teresa's Directory](https://core-docs.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/documents/asset/uploaded_file/3524/stteresasofakron/4554402/2024_Parish_Council_Directory.pdf). He receives mail at a PO Box in Elba [St. Teresa's Directory](https://core-docs.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/documents/asset/uploaded_file/3524/stteresasofakron/4554402/2024_Parish_Council_Directory.pdf). While the parcels 16.-1-24 and 16.-1-1.2 appear on Cider Solar project maps, specific ownership by Elliott could not be independently verified in available public exhibits, though his residency in the town is confirmed [Cider Solar Exhibit 4](http://cidersolarfarm.com/assets/pdfs/public_exhibits/Exh_04.pdf) [St. Teresa's Directory](https://core-docs.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/documents/asset/uploaded_file/3524/stteresasofakron/4554402/2024_Parish_Council_Directory.pdf). No public statements regarding development projects were found.
neighbors.influence_justification: Church council member; no other public roles found

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage through local parish connections or direct mail to his PO Box; focus on respecting community character and addressing any potential impacts to his residence or property.

citations.claim: Thomas Elliott is a resident of Elba, NY, listed as a member of the St. Teresa's Pastoral Council (2023-2024)
citations.title: St. Teresa's Pastoral Council Directory 2023-2024

citations.claim: He receives mail at a PO Box in Elba
citations.title: St. Teresa's Pastoral Council Directory 2023-2024

citations.claim: Parcels 16.-1-24 and 16.-1-1.2 appear on Cider Solar project maps
citations.title: Cider Solar Exhibit 4: Project Area Tax Parcels

neighbors.name: Gardiner Cemetery
neighbors.claims: Gardiner Cemetery is a historic burial ground located within the private property at 3815 Lockport Road in Elba (Tax Map ID 16.-1-32) [Cider Solar CRAMMP](https://documents.dps.ny.gov/public/Common/ViewDoc.aspx?DocRefId={C07B4093-0000-CF97-987A-11531759BCF5}&DocTitle=Cider%20Solar_CRAMMP_Rev2%20-%20Redacted) [Cider Solar Exhibit 7](http://cidersolarfarm.com/assets/pdfs/public_exhibits/Exh_07_1of2.pdf). The project has developed specific Screen Planting Plans to install vegetative buffers along the southern border of the solar farm and near the cemetery to mitigate visual impacts [Cider Solar CRAMMP](https://documents.dps.ny.gov/public/Common/ViewDoc.aspx?DocRefId={C07B4093-0000-CF97-987A-11531759BCF5}&DocTitle=Cider%20Solar_CRAMMP_Rev2%20-%20Redacted).

approach_recommendations.engage: Coordinate with the property owner of 3815 Lockport Road and town officials to ensure approved vegetative screening is installed and cemetery access is maintained.

citations.claim: Gardiner Cemetery is a historic burial ground located within the private property at 3815 Lockport Road in Elba (Tax Map ID 16.-1-32)
citations.title: Cider Solar Cultural Resources Avoidance, Minimization and Mitigation Plan

citations.claim: Tax Map ID 16.-1-32 is listed in project exhibits
citations.title: Cider Solar Exhibit 7: Noise

citations.claim: The project has developed specific Screen Planting Plans to install vegetative buffers along the southern border
citations.title: Cider Solar Cultural Resources Avoidance, Minimization and Mitigation Plan

neighbors.name: Jeffrey Boyce
neighbors.claims: Jeffrey Boyce is identified as the owner of parcel 16.-1-1.112 in the Town of Elba, Genesee County ([Genesee County Planning Dept](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/content/county/v/12/department-content/planning/agricultural-and-farmland-protection/2025-03-18-meeting-packet.pdf)). Public records and meeting minutes do not indicate any active role in local government or public statements regarding development projects ([Town of Oakfield](https://townofoakfieldny.gov/town-officials/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Private landowner; no public role identified

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out with a personal, one-on-one approach at his property, emphasizing respect for farmland use and how the project will preserve rural character.

neighbors.profile_summary: Jeffrey Boyce is a private landowner in Genesee County with no documented public stance on development.

citations.claim: Identified as owner of parcel 16.-1-1.112 in the Town of Elba
citations.title: Genesee County Agricultural and Farmland Protection Board Meeting Packet

neighbors.name: Brice Johnson
neighbors.claims: Brice Johnson is a participating landowner in the Cider Solar Farm project, having signed a lease agreement with Hecate Energy Cider Solar LLC in January 2023 ([NYS DPS](https://documents.dps.ny.gov/public/Common/ViewDoc.aspx?DocRefId={C04B4D91-0000-C72D-923C-C58FC173D7D1})). He serves as a Board Member for the Genesee SnoPackers, a local snowmobile club ([Genesee SnoPackers](https://geneseesnopackers.com/index.php/club-information/boardofdirectors/)). He is the son of the late Esther Johnson, a long-time resident of Oakfield ([The Daily News](https://www.bataviafuneralhomes.com/obituaries/esther-johnson-22)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Board member of local recreational club; participating landowner in major energy project

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage as a project participant and community leader; leverage his role in the SnoPackers to understand recreational land use concerns.

neighbors.profile_summary: Brice Johnson is a participating landowner in the Cider Solar project and serves on the board of a local snowmobile club.

She holds no known local government position and has not been publicly noted in development debates ([Town of Oakfield](https://townofoakfieldny.gov/town-officials/)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a respectful, face-to-face discussion focusing on the project’s minimal intrusion and assurances that rural peace will be maintained.

neighbors.name: George Shamblin Estate
neighbors.claims: Records indicate George Shamblin is deceased (died circa 2012), and the property is currently listed under the George Shamblin Estate [Genesee County Prosgar](https://geneseecounty.prosgar.com/PROSParcel/Parcel/494?swis=183801). His widow, Lorene May Shamblin, recently passed away in January 2025, leaving the estate to surviving family members [Batavia Funeral Homes](https://www.bataviafuneralhomes.com/obituaries/lorene-shamblin). Parcel 12.-1-58 is explicitly identified as lands of the George Shamblin Estate in project surveys [DPS NY](https://documents.dps.ny.gov/public/Common/ViewDoc.aspx?DocRefId={C04B4D91-0000-C847-993C-A63F1E4E967C}).

approach_recommendations.engage: Direct outreach to the estate executor or surviving adult heirs (children) identified in recent obituaries to determine decision-making authority for the property.

neighbors.name: Anne Bezon
neighbors.claims: Anne M. Bezon is the designated owner of parcel 16.-1-29.12 (3948 Lockport Rd) in the Town of Elba/Oakfield [Genesee County Real Property](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/sharedassets/county/v/1/treasurer/assessment-rolls/elba-2025-tentative-roll.pdf). She serves as the Coordinator for the Justice for Children Advocacy Center under Genesee County, a role confirming her involvement in local social services [NYS Senate](https://www.nysenate.gov/sites/default/files/articles/attachments/NYS%20Childrens%20Alliance.pdf). While active in county service, no public records were found regarding her specific stance on renewable energy development.

approach_recommendations.engage: Highlight local benefits to community services and youth programs, leveraging her background in county social work and emphasizing how development revenues could support social initiatives.

neighbors.name: Brian Pritchett
neighbors.claims: Brian Pritchett is a New York State Police Trooper active in the Genesee County area [WBTA](https://wbtai.com/morning-news-brief-530/). He has demonstrated support for renewable development by signing a Right-of-Way (ROW) Easement with Hecate Energy Cider Solar LLC in July 2023 for parcel 16.-1-6 [DPS NY](https://documents.dps.ny.gov/public/Common/ViewDoc.aspx?DocRefId={C04B4D91-0000-C72D-923C-C58FC173D7D1}). He is listed as the owner of said parcel in project tax agreements [GCEDC](https://www.gcedc.com/file-library/100229/HecateEnergyCiderSolarLLC.TaxAgreement.9.13.24.pdf).

approach_recommendations.engage: Maintain relationship as a participating landowner; utilize his law enforcement background to discuss traffic safety plans during construction phases.

neighbors.name: Daniel Dart
neighbors.claims: Project survey documents identify Daniel Dart (also listed as Daniel C. Dart) as the owner of parcels 12.-1-5.1 and 12.-1-5.2 in Genesee County, located along Lockport Road ([source](https://documents.dps.ny.gov/public/Common/ViewDoc.aspx?DocRefId={C04B4D91-0000-C847-993C-A63F1E4E967C}&DocTitle=AttC_CSF_ALTAIndex)). County planning records from March 2025 list these parcels in a review of agricultural district modifications, specifically noting them under 'removals' ([source](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/content/county/v/12/department-content/planning/agricultural-and-farmland-protection/2025-03-18-meeting-packet.pdf)). No evidence was found of Dart holding public office or providing public testimony in Genesee County planning meeting minutes as of early 2025 ([source](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/content/county/v/12/department-content/planning/agricultural-and-farmland-protection/2025-03-18-meeting-packet.pdf)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage one-on-one to build rapport. Given the agricultural district administrative review of his land, he may have specific questions regarding land classification and property value. Emphasize respectful dialogue.

neighbors.name: Laura Winn
neighbors.claims: Laural L. Winn is identified in county assessment records and solar project exhibits as the owner of parcel 16.-1-25 in the Town of Elba, Genesee County ([source](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/content/county/v/12/department-content/planning/agricultural-and-farmland-protection/2025-03-18-meeting-packet.pdf)) ([source](http://cidersolarfarm.com/assets/pdfs/public_exhibits/Exh_04.pdf)). The property consists of approximately 10.3 acres ([source](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/content/county/v/12/department-content/planning/agricultural-and-farmland-protection/2025-03-18-meeting-packet.pdf)). There are no public records of Winn taking a position on local development or appearing in town meeting minutes in Genesee County; records of a 'Laura Winn' involved in politics in Michigan or arts in Vermont are for different individuals ([source](https://www.geneseeny.gov/files/content/county/v/12/department-content/planning/agricultural-and-farmland-protection/2025-03-18-meeting-packet.pdf)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach her in a neighborly manner to introduce the project and invite her feedback. Listen to any concerns she raises, particularly regarding privacy given her residential acreage.

neighbors.claims: Joshua Wilder is listed as the owner of parcel 16.-1-29.2 (3962 Lockport Rd) in Genesee County’s property roll ([source](https://townofelba.prosgar.com/PROSParcel/Parcel/1566?swis=183489)). He does not hold any known public office or leadership position in the community.

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out informally to explain the project and ask for his perspective. Emphasize that his input is valued and that the project team will address any personal or property concerns he may have.

neighbors.claims: Glennda Boyce is the listed owner of parcel 16.-1-1.12 in the Town of Elba, as confirmed by Cider Solar project filings [Cider Solar Exhibit 4](http://cidersolarfarm.com/assets/pdfs/public_exhibits/Exh_04.pdf) [Cider Solar Exhibit 3](http://cidersolarfarm.com/assets/pdfs/public_exhibits/Exh_03.pdf). Public records corroborate her residency in Elba, NY [National Public Data](https://nationalpublicdata.com/people/b/glenda-boyce/). No public comments or media references regarding renewable energy development were found for this individual.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach via neighborly introduction; confirm correct name (Glennda Boyce vs Glenda Bloom) and address standard residential concerns regarding viewshed and noise.

neighbors.name: Call Farms, Inc.
neighbors.claims: Call Farms, Inc. (dba Call Lands/My-T Acres) is a major agricultural enterprise in Genesee County, established and operated by the Call family for multiple generations ([Genesee County Chamber of Commerce](https://members.geneseeny.com/list/member/call-lands-my-t-acres-inc-53)). The farm spans approximately 8,500 acres across Genesee, Orleans, and Livingston Counties, producing chip potatoes, sweet corn, snap beans, and other crops ([Genesee County Chamber of Commerce](https://members.geneseeny.com/list/member/call-lands-my-t-acres-inc-53)). It employs roughly 30 full-time staff and utilizes extensive irrigation infrastructure to ensure consistent production ([Genesee County Chamber of Commerce](https://members.geneseeny.com/list/member/call-lands-my-t-acres-inc-53)). Call Farms, Inc. was honored as Genesee County's 2019 Agricultural Business of the Year, recognizing its sustained growth and contribution to the local agricultural economy ([Genesee County Chamber of Commerce](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8FxV7oumUHU)). The company is a participating landowner in the Cider Solar Farm project, having signed agreements to include its parcels in the 500 MW development ([Hecate Energy Cider Solar](http://cidersolarfarm.com/assets/pdfs/public_exhibits/Exh_04.pdf)).
neighbors.influence_justification: High – Operates one of the largest farms in the region (8,500 acres); recognized as 2019 Agricultural Business of the Year; major employer and landowner participating in the Cider Solar project.

approach_recommendations.engage: Maintain close communication with the Call family leadership (e.g., Peter Call), emphasizing the project's benefits to their farm's long-term stability. Acknowledge their stature in the community and address any concerns collaboratively, while avoiding pressuring them into a public spotlight given their preference for low-profile support.

neighbors.profile_summary: Call Farms, Inc. (My-T Acres) is a prominent, large-scale agricultural operation in Genesee County controlling over 8,500 acres. The entity is a participating landowner in the Cider Solar Farm project and holds significant influence as a major local employer and award-winning business.

citations.claim: Call Farms, Inc. (dba Call Lands/My-T Acres) is a major agricultural enterprise... established and operated by the Call family for multiple generations
citations.title: Call Lands/My-T Acres, Inc. Member Profile

citations.title: Call Lands/My-T Acres, Inc. Member Profile

citations.title: 2019 Agricultural Business of The Year: My-T Acres

citations.claim: participating landowner in the Cider Solar Farm project, having signed agreements
citations.title: Cider Solar Farm Exhibit 4: Real Property

neighbors.name: Norton Farms Inc
neighbors.claims: Norton Farms Inc is a multi-generational family dairy farm based in Elba, NY ([Orleans Hub](https://orleanshub.com/ny-farm-bureau-elects-new-president/)). The farm's principal, Dean Norton, is a prominent agricultural leader who served as President of the New York Farm Bureau for eight years (2008–2016) ([Orleans Hub](https://orleanshub.com/ny-farm-bureau-elects-new-president/)). He has also served on the American Farm Bureau Board of Directors, highlighting significant influence in state and national agricultural policy ([Orleans Hub](https://orleanshub.com/dean-norton-of-elba-president-of-ny-farm-bureau-seeks-national-post/)). Norton Farms Inc is a participating landowner in the Cider Solar Farm project, having signed option agreements to lease land for the 500 MW development ([Hecate Energy Cider Solar](http://cidersolarfarm.com/assets/pdfs/public_exhibits/Exh_04.pdf)). The entity represents a substantial local agribusiness operation with deep ties to the agricultural community ([Orleans Hub](https://orleanshub.com/ny-farm-bureau-elects-new-president/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: High – Led by Dean Norton, former President of the New York Farm Bureau (8-year tenure) and American Farm Bureau Board member; deeply embedded in local and state agricultural policy networks.

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage Dean Norton directly, respecting his expertise and leadership in the farm community. Provide transparent, fact-based updates on project impacts and benefits to farming; gaining his continued confidence is key, as his tacit support and credibility will help prevent or defuse local opposition.

neighbors.profile_summary: Norton Farms Inc is a long-standing dairy operation in Elba, NY, led by former New York Farm Bureau President Dean Norton. The farm is a participating lessor in the Cider Solar Farm project and holds high community influence due to its leadership's extensive political and agricultural connections.

citations.claim: Norton Farms Inc is a multi-generational family dairy farm based in Elba, NY
citations.title: NY Farm Bureau elects new president

citations.title: Dean Norton of Elba, president of NY Farm Bureau, seeks national post

citations.claim: participating landowner in the Cider Solar Farm project, having signed option agreements
citations.title: Cider Solar Farm Exhibit 4: Real Property

overview_summary: Of the 17 neighbors profiled, 15 are individual residents and two are high-influence agricultural organizations—Call Farms and Norton Farms—that support the project through land lease agreements. While 13 neighbors maintain an unknown stance and 12 have low or unknown influence, the support of four neighbors and the presence of three medium-influence individuals help mitigate the risk of local opposition. Currently, there are zero documented opponents among the identified private landowners and entities in this rural agricultural area.
map_legend_html:
# Name Status
1 Brice Johnson Medium Support
2 Anne Bezon Medium
3 Brian Pritchett Medium Support
